caption: Attribute Dictionary
description: The Attribute Dictionary defines schema attributes and includes references to the events and objects in which they are used.
name: dictionary

action.caption: Action
action.description: The resultant action carried out in an event, e.g. allowed, blocked for network flows.

agreed_protocol_version.caption: Agreed Protocol Version
agreed_protocol_version.description: Negotiaged and Agreed Upon TLS Protocol Version

authentication_type.caption: Authentication Type
authentication_type.description: The type of authentication used, e.g. AuthHeader for authentication headers, QueryString for query string (pre-signed URL) or a - for unauthenticated requests.

aws_rule.caption: Rule
aws_rule.description: The rule object describes rules associated with a policy or event.

cache_response.caption: Cache Response
cache_response.description: Server classification of the response, e.g. in case of CloudFront logs - Hit, Miss

cluster_name.caption: Cluster Name
cluster_name.description: The name for the container cluster

cluster_uid.caption: Cluster UID
cluster_uid.description: The unique identifer for the container cluster

configuration.caption: Configuration Data
configuration.description: Details resource configurations as determined by AWS Config

container_orchestration_runtime.caption: Container Orchestration Runtime Object
container_orchestration_runtime.description: The object to contain the information that describes the runtime environment of a container

container_pull_end.caption: Container Pull End Time
container_pull_end.description: The timestamp for when the container pull completed.

container_pull_start.caption: Container Pull Start Time
container_pull_start.description: The timestamp for when the container pull began.

cpu.caption: CPU Allocation
cpu.description: The CPU units allocated to a runtime environment. A container instance has 1,024 cpu units for every CPU core.

deployment_uid.caption: deployment_uid
deployment_uid.description: A unique identifer for a container deployment

desired_status.caption: Desired Status
desired_status.description: The desired status of the target

event_reason.caption: event_reason
event_reason.description: The provided reason to describe why an event has been logged

event_type.caption: The Event Type
event_type.description: The type of event. For ECS, this would describe state changes to a runtime instance.

excluded.caption: Rule exclusion
excluded.description: Whether or not the associated rule has been excluded from the operation. Rules that are excluded will be counted but will not result in a block action.

group_uid.caption: Group UID
group_uid.description: The unique identifer to describe a group of rules

hostname_uid.caption: hostname_uid
hostname_uid.description: A unique identifer to recognize the endpoint where a WAF request originated.

integration.caption: Integration
integration.description: Integration Object describes the values of the integration of two or more services, relationships/associations between 2 or more resources

issuer_dn.caption: Issuer DN
issuer_dn.description: Issuer Disinguished name (DN) of a digital certificate

kubernetes.caption: kubernetes
kubernetes.description: Kubernetes object describes details related to a K8 entity

last_status.caption: last_status
last_status.description: The last reported status from the runtime environment for a container

lb_actions.caption: Load Balancer Actions
lb_actions.description: The actions performed by the load balancer

authenticate.caption: AUTHENTICATE
authenticate.description: The load balancer validated the session, authenticated the user, and added the user information to the request headers, as specified by the rule configuration.

fixed-response.caption: FIXED-RESPONSE
fixed-response.description: The load balancer issued a fixed response, as specified by the rule configuration.

forward.caption: FORWARD
forward.description: The load balancer forwarded the request to a target, as specified by the rule configuration.

redirect.caption: REDIRECT
redirect.description: The load balancer redirected the request to another URL, as specified by the rule configuration.

waf.caption: WAF
waf.description: The load balancer forwarded the request to AWS WAF to determine whether the request should be forwarded to the target. If this is the final action, AWS WAF determined that the request should be rejected.

waf-failed.caption: WAF-FAILED
waf-failed.description: The load balancer attempted to forward the request to AWS WAF, but this process failed.

level.caption: Level
level.description: AuditLevel at which event was generated

limit_key.caption: Limit Key
limit_key.description: Indicates the IP address source that AWS WAF should use to aggregate requests for rate limiting by a rate-based rule. Possible values are IP, for web request origin, and FORWARDED_IP, for an IP forwarded in a header in the request.

limit_value.caption: Limit Value
limit_value.description: The IP address used by a rate-based rule to aggregate requests for rate limiting. If a request contains an IP address that isn't valid, the limitvalue is INVALID.

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.description: Load balancer object describes details related to a load balancer entity (e.g. AWS ELB)

matched_rule_priority.caption: matched_rule_priority
matched_rule_priority.description: The priority of the matching rule

matching.caption: Matching
matching.description: A boolean value to identify if the associated rule matched the logged event

max_rate_allowed.caption: Maximum Rate Allowed
max_rate_allowed.description: The maximum number of requests, which have an identical value in the field that is specified by limitKey, allowed in a five-minute period. If the number of requests exceeds the maxRateAllowed and the other predicates specified in the rule are also met, AWS WAF triggers the action that is specified for this rule.

memory.caption: Memory Allocation
memory.description: The amount of memory, in MB, allocated to a container runtime

network_connection.caption: Network Connection
network_connection.description: Describes the protocol, direction, source, and destination of a network connection. Intended to be used alongside Network Traffic.

network_traffic.caption: Network Traffic
network_traffic.description: Describes the network data traffic. Network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.

node_ip.caption: Node IP
node_ip.description: The IP of the Node inside the Kubernetes cluster

node_name.caption: Node Name
node_name.description: The Name of the Node inside the Kubernetes cluster

not_after.caption: Not After
not_after.description: The maximum TLS certificate's validty period

not_before.caption: Not Before
not_before.description: The minimum TLS certificate's validty period

orchestration.caption: Container Orchestration
orchestration.description: An object to describe the orchestration of a container task

overrides.caption: Overrides
overrides.description: A list of any overrides present to take precedent over the default values for the container runtime

pem.caption: PEM
pem.description: An identifier for an associated PEM format for certificates

pod_ip.caption: Pod IP
pod_ip.description: The IP of the pod inside the Kubernetes cluster

pod_name.caption: Pod Name
pod_name.description: The name of the pod inside the Kubernetes cluster

pod_namespace.caption: Pod Name
pod_namespace.description: The Namespace where the pod is located inside the Kubernetes cluster

pod_uid.caption: Pod ID
pod_uid.description: The unique ID of the pod inside the Kubernetes cluster

redirect_url.caption: redirect_url
redirect_url.description: The URL specified for redirection by the LB

relation.caption: Relation/Association
relation.description: Defines the relationship amongst the resources

reporter.caption: Reporter
reporter.description: Descrbies who reported the log e.g. Source, Destination, Unkown

request_classification.caption: Request Classification
request_classification.description: The classification for desync mitigation, enclosed in double quotes. If the request does not comply with RFC 7230, the possible values are Acceptable, Ambiguous, and Severe.

request_classification_reason.caption: Request Classification Reason
request_classification_reason.description: The classification reason code, enclosed in double quotes. If the request does not comply with RFC 7230, this is one of the classification codes described in Classification reasons. If the request complies with RFC 7230, this value is set to -.

request_creation_time.caption: Request Creation Time
request_creation_time.description: The time when the load balancer received the request from the client, in ISO 8601 format.

request_id.caption: Request Identifier
request_id.description: A unique identifier to track the HTTP request

request_processing_time.caption: request_processing_time
request_processing_time.description: The total time elapsed (in seconds, with millisecond precision) from the time the load balancer received the request until the time it sent the request to a target.

requested_version_uid.description: For negotiation, the version request for HTTP

requester_id.caption: Requester ID
requester_id.description: Details a requester's identifiers whenever avaialble

resource_path.caption: Resource Path
resource_path.description: The Route Key/Resource Path of the API request, for example /pets. Will include the path pattern used to handle the request.

response_processing_time.caption: response_processing_time
response_processing_time.description: The total time elapsed (in seconds, with millisecond precision) from the time the load balancer received the response header from the target until it started to send the response to the client. This includes both the queuing time at the load balancer and the connection acquisition time from the load balancer to the client.

rule_details.caption: Rule details
rule_details.description: Details provided to descrive the rule and the rule's behavior

server_protocol.caption: Server Protocol
server_protocol.description: For negotiation, the protocol offered by the server

severity_score.caption: Severity Score
severity_score.description: The severity score of a finding

signature_version.caption: Signature version
signature_version.description: The AWS signature version used for Authentication

stage.caption: Stage
stage.description: Stage or phase of an entity(e.g. Dev, Test, Stage, Prod et al)

stage_timestamp.caption: Stage Timestamp
stage_timestamp.description: Time the request reached current audit stage

subject_dn.caption: Subject DN
subject_dn.description: Subject Disinguished name (DN) of a digital certificate

target_group_uid.caption: Target Group UID
target_group_uid.description: A unique identifier to recognize the target for a load balancer connection

target_processing_time.caption: target_processing_time
target_processing_time.description: The total time elapsed (in seconds, with millisecond precision) from the time the load balancer sent the request to a target until the target started to send the response headers.

target_status_code.caption: target_status_code
target_status_code.description: The status code of the utilized target for an LB target action.

target_status_code_list.caption: target_status_code_list
target_status_code_list.description: A space-delimited list of status codes from the responses of the targets, enclosed in double quotes. Currently, this list can contain one item and it matches the target_status_code field.

task_uid.caption: Task UID
task_uid.description: The unique identifier for a task utilized in a container runtime environment

tls_client_protocol.caption: TLS Client Protocol
tls_client_protocol.description: The application protocol negotiated with the client, in string format. The possible values are h2, http/1.1, and http/1.0. If no ALPN policy is configured in the TLS listener, no matching protocol is found, or no valid protocol list is sent, this value is set to -.

tls_listener_uid.caption: TLS Listener UID
tls_listener_uid.description: The unique identifier of a TLS listener (e.g. AWS ELB Listener arn)

tls_server_protocol.caption: TLS Server Protocol
tls_server_protocol.description: The application protocol negotiated with the target, in string format. The possible values are h2, http/1.1, and http/1.0. If no ALPN policy is configured in the TLS listener, no matching protocol is found, or no valid protocol list is sent, this value is set to -.

total_connection_time.caption: Total Connection Time
total_connection_time.description: The total time for the connection to complete, from start to closure, in milliseconds.

turn_around_time.description: The number of milliseconds that Amazon S3 spent processing your request. This value is measured from the time the last byte of your request was received until the time the first byte of the response was sent.

url_path.caption: URL Path
url_path.description: The URL path as extracted from the URL. For example: /download/trouble.

use_case.caption: Use case identifier
use_case.description: The usecase identifier of an entity
